body.p: Elias Martin says he is and has been acquainted with Thomas B. Wadlington and with his general character for many years, that he lives a neighbor to said Wadlington, that he is an honest uprwright and law abiding citizen, and so regarded by his acquaintances. He further states, that he is acquainted with the character of the witness John Prince, and from his characer, and from his personal knowledge of said Prince he does not believe him to be entitled to credit as a sworn witness in a court of Justice, and he does believe, that the evidence he gave in ^the^ case as to the manner of the Killing and as to who committed the first attack is untrue. and he does believe, that said Wadlington has been unjustly convicted on false testimony. He says he knows said Prince well, he said Prince lived with him for a whole year
Sworn to and subscribed before me by Elias B. Martin -- This 9th Feby 1861.

B. F. Cantrell and Eli Nichols say they were present when the foregoing affidavit of E. B. Martin was written and signed, and after hearing the same read over do say they believe the statements as made above by said Martin is true, and they do most cordially adopt said Martins affidavit as their own. only that said Prince did not live with them.
Sworn to and subscribed before me by Eli Nichols and B. F. Cantrell -- This 9th day of Feby 1861.
